alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Central and Southern Scott County; Garland; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Polk County Lower Elevations; Saline; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Perry, southwestern Conway, Garland, southern Scott, Polk, northwestern Saline, southern Yell, Montgomery and northwestern Pulaski Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blackwell to near Danville to near Waldron. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... Hot Springs... West Little Rock... Hot Springs Village... Morrilton... Mena... Perryville... Mount Ida... Ola... Oppelo... Mountain Pine... Hatfield... Norman... Perry... Oden... Adona... Houston... Vandervoort... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Meyers... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and western Arkansas.
